intro: Pimpinella anisoides, commonly known as anise weed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can be invasive in some areas. The seeds of Pimpinella anisoides are aromatic and resemble those of anise, giving the plant its common name.
